ref BGB both list of winners and history--> |- | 1938 | England |- | 1937 | England <!--1936 England deleted by ref BGB both list of winners and history--> |}
The 1939 contest was not completed and the next six did not take place because of [[World War II]].<ref name=history />
==Players== {{gcb|team|Teams}} competition in bridge requires a minimum of four players on each team; up to two additional players may be added as alternates. Two tables are in play at the same time with the North–South pair at one table and East–West pair at the other table being teammates.
Camrose matches comprise two sets of 16 deals with player substitutions permitted between sets.<ref name=event2011/> Since 2007 the annual event comprises ten matches for each national team; previously there were eight or six matches. All 2011 participants played in 80 to 144 of 160 deals on the second weekend, or five to nine of ten sets (five matches), led by Rex Anderson and David Greenwood who played nine sets for Northern Ireland.<ref name=event2011/> Anderson is the career leader with 92 ''matches'' played (through 2011).
{| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Career Leaders by Nation{{citation needed|date=February 2014}} ! Nation || Player || Matches <!--evidently thru 2011--> |- | [[Northern Ireland]] | Rex Anderson | align=center|106 |- | [[Wales]] | [[Patrick Jourdain]] *  | align=center|75 |- | [[Scotland]] | Les Steel | align=center|59 |- | England | John Armstrong | align=center|39 |- | [[Republic of Ireland]] | Tom Hanlon | align=center|30 |} :<nowiki>*</nowiki><small>Patrick Jourdain also played two matches for Scotland.</small>
==Trophies== Trophies are awarded for each match, in addition to the overall trophy.
{| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Trophies for Individual matches ! Walshe Trophy | Republic of Ireland v Northern Ireland |- | Cyfeillion Beiriste Trophy | Republic of Ireland v Wales |- | Causeway Trophy | Wales v Northern Ireland |}

{{Infobox video game |title=Carmageddon TDR 2000 |image = Carmageddon TDR 2000 cover.jpg |caption = Cover art of the European Windows version |developer = [[Torus Games]] |publisher = [[Sales Curve Interactive]] (EU)
[[Xicat Interactive]] (NA) |designer = |series= ''[[Carmageddon (series)|Carmageddon]]'' |released = {{vgrelease|EU|September 1, 2000}}{{vgrelease|NA|December 14, 2000}} |genre = [[Vehicular combat game|Vehicular combat]] |modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]], [[multiplayer game|multiplayer]] |platforms = [[Microsoft Windows]] }} '''''Carmageddon TDR 2000''''' (also known as '''''Carmageddon: Total Destruction Racing 2000''''' or '''''Carmageddon 3: TDR 2000''''' in North America), is a [[vehicular combat game|vehicular combat]] [[video game]]. The sequel to ''[[Carmageddon II: Carpocalypse Now]]'', it was developed by [[Torus Games]] and released in the United Kingdom on September 1, 2000, and on December 14 in North America. == Description == [[image:Carmageddon TDR 2000 in-game screenshot (Windows).png|thumb|left|Driving around the first level, ''The Boulevard'']] The title is a homage to the inspiration for the ''Carmageddon'' series, ''[[Death Race 2000]]''. As with the other games in the series, one of the most controversial aspects was that [[pedestrian]]s could be killed by immolation (being set on fire) or graphic [[collision]]s that could include [[dismemberment]]. In some countries, the human pedestrians were replaced with [[zombie]]s - actually only changing the red blood to green slime - but [[Patch (computing)|patches]] were circulated on the internet that reverted the game to its original state. While still part of the game series' canon, the gameplay was not a significant advancement on the original, which resulted in poor sales for the game and blurred the chances of a 4th installment of the series. However, almost 12 years later, a long-awaited 4th installment of the series was announced on the official site, called Carmageddon: Reincarnation.{{cite web |url=http://www.carmageddon.com/reincarnation |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-06-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110613083024/http://www.carmageddon.com/reincarnation |archivedate=2011-06-13 |df= }} During development of TDR 2000, SCi hired Tozzer.com to create an online comic based on the ''Carmageddon'' video game.[http://www.tozzer.com/carm/carm.htm Tozzer - the kid, the comic, the movies, the mayhem] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070427220318/http://www.tozzer.com/carm/carm.htm |date=2007-04-27 }} A [[Game Boy Color]] version of the game was also slated to be released however it was cancelled for unknown reasons.{{cite web |url=http://www.carmageddon.com/history/carmageddon-tdr-2000-game-boy-color |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-08-07 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120818120917/http://www.carmageddon.com/history/carmageddon-tdr-2000-game-boy-color |archivedate=2012-08-18 |df= }} ==Expansion pack== ''The Nosebleed Pack'' was the official expansion pack for ''TDR2000'' adding new vehicles, environments, powerups and improved multiplayer modes with extra maps. It was later released as a free [[Patch (computing)|patch]]. The soundtrack is by Plague and [[Utah Saints]]. ==Reception== {{Video game reviews |GR = 61.79%{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/pc/451392-carmageddon-3-tdr-2000/index.html|title=Carmageddon |Atrip = 7.1/10{{cite web|url=http://www.actiontrip.com/reviews/carmageddon-tdr-2000.phtml|title=Carmageddon TDR 2000 Review|last=Grbavcic|first=Dejan "Dex"|publisher=[[CraveOnline|ActionTrip]]|date=2000-09-22|accessdate=2014-01-02|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140102192914/http://www.actiontrip.com/reviews/carmageddon-tdr-2000.phtml|archivedate=2014-01-02|df=}} revision.comment: In first "History" paragraph, changed "conducive, to" to the more correct "conducive, to".
revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=July 2007}} {{about|literary continuators|a 'continuator state' in geopolitics|succession of states}}
A '''continuator''', in [[literature]], is a writer who creates a new work based on someone else's prior text, such as a [[novel]] or novel fragment. The new work may complete the older work (as with the numerous continuations of [[Jane Austen]]'s unfinished novel ''[[Sanditon]]''), or may try to serve as a [[sequel]] or [[prequel]] to the older work (such as [[Alexandra Ripley]]'s ''[[Scarlett (Ripley novel)|Scarlett]]'', an authorized continuation of [[Margaret Mitchell]]'s ''[[Gone with the Wind (novel)|Gone with the Wind]]''). This phenomenon differs from those authors who, because they share a common culture, use characters or themes from a common cultural stock.
==History== The development of [[Europe]]an classical literature out of the common stock of oral tradition proved conducive to reworkings, revisions, and [[satire]]s. Numerous writers of [[Greece]]'s golden age revived and reworked stories of the [[Trojan War]] and [[Greek mythology]], although they were not strictly continuators as, for the most part, they did not invent or even extrapolate much from the received stories, choosing to alter the tone and treatment rather than the stories.
[[Latin literature]], on the other hand, may be regarded as systematic continuators of Greek models. The pinnacle of [[Augustan literature]], the ''[[Aeneid]]'', is essentially a continuation of the ''[[Iliad]]'': not only in that it follows a minor character from his imagined origins in [[Troy]] to his founding of [[Rome]], but in that it continues a historical ethos. This move, by connecting the Roman empire both culturally and pseudo-historically to the Homeric myth, is commonly viewed as a move by [[Virgil]] to legitimize the Roman empire. For instance, the epic opens with a summary of the progress of Aeneas and his progeny (in [[John Dryden]]'s translation):
<poem> :Arms, and the man I sing, who, forc'd by fate, :And haughty Juno's unrelenting hate, :Expel'd and exil'd, left the Trojan shore. :Long labors, both by sea and land, he bore, :And in the doubtful war, before he won :The Latian realm, and built the destin'd town; :His banish'd gods restor'd to rites divine, :And settled sure succession in his line, :From whence the race of Alban fathers come, :And the long glories of majestic Rome. </poem>
[[W. A. Camps]] expresses this common analysis of Virgil when he writes, "There is more than one reminder in the poem that its hero Aeneas is ancestor of Octavian through the supposed descent of [[gens Julia|the Julii]] [i.e., Octavian's family] through Aeneas' son Julius."{{ref|1}}
Like their medieval predecessors, [[Renaissance]] authors drew inspiration from earlier writers. More significantly, the spread of printing, slow increase in literacy, and the development of capitalism conspired to shape a modern concept of text and authorship. In this context, one sees "continuators" in the modern sense: authors either inspired or hired to complete or continue a predecessor's concept. This habit was most noticeable in the most commercialized spheres of literature. [[Elizabethan drama]], for example, is full of examples. As an instance of completion, [[Francis Godolphin Waldron]] completed ''The Sad Shepherd'', a late unfinished play by [[Ben Jonson]]. As an instance of sequel-writing, [[John Fletcher (playwright)|John Fletcher]]'s ''The Tamer Tamed'' continues and lampoons Shakespeare's ''[[The Taming of the Shrew]]''. Controversial literature was amenable to such continuations, as evidenced most especially by the [[Martin Marprelate]] affair; [[Philip Sidney]]'s ''[[Countess of Pembroke's Arcadia|Arcadia]]'' was continued by [[Anna Weamys]].
==Notes== #{{note|1}}Camps, W.A. ''An Introduction to Virgil's Aeneid'', Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1969, 1-2.
==Sources== *Boitani, Piero (1989). ''The European Tragedy of Troilus''. Oxford: Clarendon Press. *Boyle, A.J., ed (1988). ''The Imperial Muse: Ramus Essays on Roman literature of the Empire to Juvenal through Ovid''. Berwick, Australia: Aureal Publications. *Braunmuller, A.R. (1990) "The Arts of the Dramatist." ''Cambridge Companion to Renaissance Drama''. A.R. Braunmuller and Daniel Hattaway, eds. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. 53-92. *Cairns, Francis (1989). ''Virgil's Augustan Epic''. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. *Chambers, E.K. (1923). ''The Elizabethan Stage''. 4 vol. Oxford: Clarendon Press. *Clark, Sandra (1994). ''The Plays of Beaumont and Fletcher: Sexual Themes and Dramatic Representation''. New York: Harvester Wheatsheaf. *Greg, W.W. (1905). ''Ben Jonson's The Sad Shepherd, with Francis Waldron's Continuation''. Materialien zur Kunde des älteren englischen dramasche. Louvain: A. Uystpruyst. *Knutson, Roslyn (2001). ''Playing Companies and Commerce in Shakespeare's Time''. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. *Smith, Alden (1997). ''Poetic Allusion and Poetic Embrace in Ovid and Vergil''. Ann Arbor, Mich.: University of Michigan Press. *Weamys, Anna (1994). ''A Continuation of Sir Philip Sidney's Arcadia''. *Patrick Cullen Colborn, ed. Women Writers in English, 1350-1850. Oxford: Oxford University Press.
[[Category:Fan fiction]] [[Category:Narrative forms]]
[[pt:Continuador]]

revision.text:
In film, de-aging is a visual effects technique used to make an actor look younger, especially for [[flashback (narrative)|flashback]] scenes.
==List of films== The following is an alphabetically ordered list of films that employ de-aging techniques: <!-- PLEASE ADD A FILM AND ITS CITATION IN ALPHABETICAL ORDER --> {| class="wikitable sortable"
! scope="col" | Film !! scope="col" | Year !! scope="col" class="unsortable" style=white-space:nowrap | Description
|-
| ''[[Ant-Man (film)|Ant-Man]]'' || 2015 || In this superhero film, actor [[Michael Douglas]], who plays the scientist who creates the [[Ant-Man]] shrinking technology, is de-aged in a flashback to 1989, during which he discovers an attempt to replicate his technology.<ref name="giardina20160510" /><ref name="giardina20170530" /><ref name="gonzales" /><ref name="merry" /> |- |''[[Ant-Man and the Wasp]]'' |2018 |In this superhero film, actors [[Michael Douglas]], [[Michelle Pfeiffer]], and [[Laurence Fishburne]] who play [[Hank Pym]], [[Wasp (comics)|Janet van Dyne]], and [[Bill Foster (comics)|Bill Foster]], respectively, are de-aged in flashback sequences.<ref name="FXGuide">{{cite web|url=https://www.fxguide.com/featured/a-bugs-wife-ant-man-and-the-wasp/|title=A Bug’s Wife: Ant-Man and the Wasp|last=Seymour|first=Mike|publisher=[[FXguide]]|date=July 16, 2018|accessdate=July 17, 2018|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/70z8ZhGzF|archivedate=July 17, 2018|deadurl=no}}</ref> |- | ''[[Captain America: Civil War]]'' || 2016 || In this superhero film, actor [[Robert Downey Jr.]], who plays Tony Stark, a.k.a. [[Iron Man]], is de-aged in a flashback scene.<ref name="giardina20160510" /> |- | ''{{sortname|The|Curious Case of Benjamin Button|dab=film}}'' || 2008 || In this film, based on a short story in which the protagonist ages backwards, actor [[Brad Pitt]], who plays Benjamin Button, is initially shown as elderly and is gradually de-aged to look progressively younger as numerous decades of the character's life go by.<ref name="giardina20160510" /><ref name="merry" /><ref name="bradley-tschirgi" /> |- | ''[[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2]]'' || 2017 || In this comic book film, actor [[Kurt Russell]], who plays the father of one of the main characters, is de-aged in a flashback scene set on Earth in the 1980s.<ref name="giardina20170530" /> |- | ''{{sortname|The|Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug}}'' || 2013 || In this fantasy film set decades before [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' film trilogy]], actor [[Orlando Bloom]] reprises his role as the Elf character [[Legolas]] and is de-aged in his scenes, to reflect the fact that the film's Elves do not age.<ref name="bradley-tschirgi" /> |- | ''{{sortname|The|Hobbit: The Battle of Five Armies}}'' || 2014 || In this fantasy film set decades before [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' film trilogy]], actor [[Orlando Bloom]] reprises his role as the Elf character [[Legolas]] and is de-aged in his scenes, to reflect the fact that the film's Elves do not age.<ref name="bradley-tschirgi" /> |- | ''[[Pee-wee's Big Holiday]]'' || 2016 || In this comedy film, actor [[Paul Reubens]] reprises his role as [[Pee-wee Herman]] 28 years after the last Pee-wee film. De-aging was applied to Reubens to make him appear the same age as he was in his last appearance.<ref name="bradley-tschirgi" /><ref name="merry" /> |- | ''[[Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales]]'' || 2017 || In this pirate film, the actor [[Johnny Depp]], who plays the main character [[Jack Sparrow]], is de-aged for a flashback scene.<ref name="giardina20170530" /> |- | ''[[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]]'' || 2016 || In this science fiction film, actress [[Carrie Fisher]]'s likeness is digitally de-aged and recreated to portray her character [[Princess Leia]] as she appeared in [[Star Wars (film)|''Star Wars'']]. |- | ''[[Terminator Genisys]]'' || 2015 || In this science fiction film, actor [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] reprises his role as the [[Terminator (character)|Terminator android]] and encounters a younger self, a de-aged portrayal.<ref name="bradley-tschirgi" /><ref name="gonzales" /> |- | ''[[The Irishman (2019 film)|The Irishman]]'' || 2019 || In this [[Biographical film|biographical]] [[crime film]] [[Robert De Niro]] will be digitally de-aged to portray a young [[Frank Sheeran|Frank "The Irishman" Sheeran]].<ref>https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2016/12/robert-de-niro-digital-facelift-the-irishman-martin-scorsese</ref> |- | ''[[Tron: Legacy]]'' || 2010 || In this science fiction film, a sequel to the 1982 film, set 27 years afterward, actor [[Jeff Bridges]], who played the protagonist Kevin Flynn in the original film, is de-aged to appear as a villainous program who looks like Flynn himself, several years younger.<ref name="bradley-tschirgi" /><ref name="gonzales" /> |- | ''[[X-Men Origins: Wolverine]]'' || 2009 || In this superhero film, actor [[Patrick Stewart]], who plays mutant [[Professor X]], is de-aged for a brief [[cameo appearance]], as the film takes place earlier in the timeline than the previous films of the series in which Stewart participated.<ref>https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2017/03/logan-x-men-origins-wolverine-hugh-jackman-patrick-stewart-deadpool/</ref> |- | ''[[X-Men: The Last Stand]]'' || 2006 || In this superhero film, actors [[Patrick Stewart]] and [[Ian McKellen]], who play the mutants [[Professor X]] and [[Magneto (comics)|Magneto]] respectively, are de-aged in a flashback scene in which the two work together to recruit a mutant girl as a student.<ref name="bradley-tschirgi" /><ref name="fxguide" /> |}
==See also== *[[Virtual actor]] *''[[Westworld (TV series)|Westworld]]'': In the third episode of this 2016 TV series, titled "The Stray", [[Anthony Hopkins]]' character, Dr. Robert Ford, was made to look several decades younger.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thrillist.com/entertainment/nation/westworld-special-effects|title=HOW 'WESTWORLD' DE-AGED ANTHONY HOPKINS & OTHER SPECIAL-EFFECT SECRETS|publisher=Thrillist|date=2016-10-17}}</ref> *''[[Twin Peaks (2017 TV series)|Twin Peaks: The Return]]'': In the eighteenth episode of this 2017 TV series, subtitled "Part 18", [[Sheryl Lee]]'s character, [[Laura Palmer]], was made to look twenty-five years younger.
==References== {{Reflist|30em|refs= <ref name="bradley-tschirgi">{{cite news | last=Bradley-Tschirgi | first=Mat | url=http://www.gamesradar.com/7-movie-actors-made-impossibly-young-by-cgi/ | title=7 movie actors made impossibly young by CGI | work=[[GamesRadar]] | date=December 1, 2016 | accessdate=May 30, 2017 }}</ref> <ref name="fxguide">{{cite news | author=Staff | url=https://www.fxguide.com/featured/x-men_extreme_makeover/ | title=X-Men: Extreme Makeover | work=[[Fxguide]] | date= | accessdate=May 30, 2017 }}</ref> <ref name="giardina20160510">{{cite magazine | last=Giardina | first=Carolyn | url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/behind-screen/how-captain-america-civil-war-892387 | title=How 'Captain America: Civil War' Turned Robert Downey Jr. Back Into a Teen | magazine=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] | date=May 10, 2016 | accessdate=May 30, 2017 }}</ref> <ref name="giardina20170530">{{cite magazine | last=Giardina | first=Carolyn | url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/behind-screen/pirates-5-guardians-2-vfx-technique-de-aging-1008206 | title=Johnny Depp to Kurt Russell: How 'De-Aging' Stars Became Hollywood's VFX Trick Du Jour | magazine=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] | date=May 30, 2017 | accessdate=May 30, 2017 }}</ref> <ref name="gonzales">{{cite news | last=Gonzales | first=Dave | url=https://www.geek.com/geek-cetera/how-terminator-genisys-made-a-synthespian-of-young-arnold-schwarzenegger-1626902/ | title=How Terminator: Genisys made a 'synthespian' of young Arnold Schwarzenegger | work=[[Geek.com]] | date=July 4, 2015 | accessdate=May 30, 2017 }}</ref> <ref name="merry">{{cite news | last=Merry | first=Stephanie | url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/hollywoods-latest-beauty-trend-digitally-retouching-an-actors-face/2016/03/18/b4e4b85e-e61d-11e5-a6f3-21ccdbc5f74e_story.html | title=Hollywood’s secret beauty trick: The special effects facelift | work=[[The Washington Post]] | date=March 18, 2016 | accessdate=May 30, 2017 }}</ref> }}
[[Category:Film]] [[Category:Ageing]] [[Category:Visual effects]] [[Category:Special effects]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox award | name = ENnies | image = | caption = | location = | country = [[United Kingdom]] & [[United States]] | description = Best [[role-playing game]]s of previous year | presenter = [[EN World]] & [[Gen Con]] | year = 2001 | website = {{url|ennie-awards.com}} | sponsor = [[Russ Morrissey]] }} The '''Annual Gen Con EN World RPG Awards''' (or '''ENnie Awards''') are annual, fan-based awards for [[role-playing game]] products and publishers hosted at [[Gen Con]] in [[Indianapolis]], [[Indiana]]. The name of the award is derived from the [[EN World]] web site that has hosted the awards since their inception in 2001. The ENnies were created by [[Russ Morrissey]] and [[Eric Noah]] and have been run and owned by [[Russ Morrissey]] since 2001.
The awards were initially focused on ''[[d20 System]]'' products and publishers and were a solely [[internet]]-based event (hosted by EN World). They have since broadened their scope to include all forms of roleplaying, and since 2002 have been announced at a live awards ceremony at Gen Con.
In 2007, the ENnies were sponsored for the first time by a corporation, [[Your Games Now]]. In 2008 they were sponsored by [http://www.avatarart.com Avatar Art]. In 2010, 2011, and 2012 they were sponsored by both [[Indie Press Revolution]] and [[DriveThruRPG]]. From 2013-2016 they were sponsored by [[DriveThruRPG]]. In 2015, [[Campaign Coins]] made the medals as a sponsorship. In 2017, [[Lone Wolf Development]] became a sponsor.
The ENnies comprise two rounds. In the first round, publishers submit their products for nomination by that year's five democratically elected judges. As of 2017, judges have had a two-year term limit, but are permitted to return after a year off. In the second round, the public votes on the nominated products, with the results being presented live at [[Gen Con]].
==Categories== The 2017 Categories were as follows:
*Best Adventure *Best Aid/Accessory *Best Interior Art *Best Cover Art *Best Blog *Best Cartography *Best Electronic Book *Best Family Game *Best Free Product *Best Miniatures Product *Best Monster/Adversary *Best Podcast *Best RPG Related Product *Best Rules *Best Setting *Best Supplement *Best Writing *Best Website *Best Game *Product of the Year *Fans’ Choice for Best Publisher
==Winners by year== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align: left;" |- |2020 |2019 |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/about-us/2018-nominations/ ''2018''] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/2017-noms-and-winners/ 2017] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/about-us/2016-ennie-award-winners/ 2016] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/about-us/2015-ennie-award-winners/ 2015] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/about-us/2014-ennie-awards-nominees/ 2014] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/about-us/2013-noms-and-winners/ 2013] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/about-us/2012-noms-and-winners/ 2012] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/?page_id=2156 2011] |- |[[2010 ENnie Award winners|2010]] |[[2009 ENnie Award winners|2009]] |[[2008 ENnie Award winners|2008]] |[[2007 ENnie Award winners|2007]] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/?page_id=1371 2006] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/?page_id=1359 2005] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/?page_id=1357 2004] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/?page_id=1355 2003] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/?page_id=1353 2002] |[http://www.ennie-awards.com/blog/?page_id=1344 2001] |- |}
== References == *{{cite journal| last=Mona | first=Erik | title=Speaking of Awards... The ENnie Nominations are In! | journal=Dungeon #102 | volume=XVII | issue=6 | pages= Polyhedron 4| publisher=Paizo Publishing LLC |date=September 2003| ref=harv}}
==External links== *[http://www.ennie-awards.com/ ENnie Awards Official Page]

revision.text:
{{Infobox Person | name =Edward LeRoy Rice | image =File:Edward Le Roy Rice (1871-1938) in 1911.png | caption =Rice in 1911 | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1871|8|24}} | birth_place =[[Manhattan, New York City]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1938|12|1|1871|8|24}} | death_place =[[Manhattan, New York City]] | death_cause = | other_names = | known_for = | education = | occupation = | spouse =Emma Rodenberger | partner = | children = | parents =William Henry Rice (1844-1907) | relatives = }} <!--[[File:Monarchs of Minstrelsy by Edward Le Roy Rice (1911).png|thumb|Monarchs of Minstrelsy by Edward Le Roy Rice (1911)]]--> '''Edward LeRoy Rice''' (August 24, 1871 - December 1, 1938) was an American producer of [[minstrel shows]]. He was the leading authority on the history of minstrel shows.<ref name=karl/><ref>{{cite news |author= |agency= |title=What Price Glory |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1924/11/16/archives/what-price-glory-again-lured-by-the-prospect-of-acquiring-some-new.html |quote=Edward Le Roy Rice, authority on minstrels and minstrel history |newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date= |accessdate=2016-07-22 }}</ref> He also bought and sold theatrical memorabilia.<ref name=archive>{{cite web |url=http://findingaids.princeton.edu/collections/TC062 |title=Edward Le Roy Rice papers |date= |accessdate=2015-03-26 |quote= |publisher=[[Princeton University]] |location= }}</ref>
==Biography== He was born in [[Manhattan, New York City]] on August 24, 1871 as the second son of William Henry Rice (1844-1907), a minstrel performer.<ref>{{cite encyclopedia |author=Kathleen Franz and Susan Smulyan |encyclopedia =Major Problems in American Popular Culture |title=Edward LeRoy Rice Remembers Minstrelsy |year=2011 |publisher= |page=31 |quote= | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=oKdalT-JurQC&pg=PA31&lpg=PA31 |isbn= }}</ref><ref name=karl>{{cite book |author=[[Karl Koenig]] |title=Jazz in Print (1859-1929) |year=2002 |publisher= |page=392 |quote= | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=sol334hPuRoC&pg=PA392 |isbn= }}</ref> He first performed on stage in [[Morristown, New Jersey]] on July 18, 1890.<ref name=book/>
He married Emma Rodenberger in [[Brooklyn, New York City]] on November 30, 1899. Starting in 1907 he wrote a column called "Man in the Bleachers" which ran in the [[New York Evening World]] for five weeks.
He was the author of Monarchs of Minstrelsy in 1911.<ref name=book>{{cite book |author=Edward Le Roy Rice |title=Monarchs of Minstrelsy |year=1911 |publisher= |page= |quote= | url= |isbn= }}</ref> He wrote a syndicated column for Press Publishing called "Anecdotes of Old-Time Actors, by 1913.<ref>{{cite news |author= |title=Anecdotes of Old-Time Actors |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1144&dat=19131210&id=BSMbAAAAIBAJ&sjid=9EkEAAAAIBAJ&pg=6435,2692187&hl=en |quote= |newspaper=[[The Pittsburgh Press]] |date=December 10, 1913 }}</ref>
He died on December 1, 1938 in [[Manhattan, New York City]]. He was buried at [[Calvary Cemetery (Queens, New York)|Calvary Cemetery]] in [[Woodside, New York]]. His archive is housed at [[Princeton University]].<ref name=archive/>
==Quote== *"Let me begin by saying that I am not a “Monarch of Minstrelsy,” not even ... I can remember, as a youngster even before my school days began, my father asking me if I wanted to be a minstrel."<ref name=book/>
==External links== *[http://www.gettyimages.com/pictures/minstrel-group-of-edward-le-roy-rice-performing-at-the-news-photo-515579126 Edward Le Roy Rice performers at the Whitehouse] at [[Getty Images]]
==References== {{commons category|Edward Le Roy Rice}} {{Reflist}}
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Rice, Edward Le Roy}} [[Category:1871 births]] [[Category:1938 deaths]] [[Category:Burials at Calvary Cemetery (Queens, New York)]] [[Category:Blackface minstrel managers and producers]] [[Category:Blackface minstrel performers]]

{{more citations needed|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox television | show_name = Fear Factor – Nieustraszeni | image = Fear Factor – Nieustraszeni (logo).png | genre = reality show | based_on = [[Fear Factor]] | director = Radoslaw Pelczynski | presenter = [[Roman Polko]] | theme_music_composer = [[Trevor Rabin]] | country = {{country|Poland}} | language = [[Polish language|Polish]] | num_seasons = 1 | num_episodes = 9 | location = [[Poland]]
[[Argentina]] (finals) | runtime = 45 minutes | company = [[Endemol|Endemol Polska]] | network = [[Polsat]] | picture_format = [[4:3]] | first_run = [[Poland]] | first_aired = 8 September 2004 | last_aired = 3 December 2004 | related = [[Fear Factor]]
[[Fear Factor (UK game show)]] }} '''Fear Factor – Nieustraszeni''' – polish reality show, based on ''[[Fear Factor]]'', produced by [[Endemol]] in 2004. The series began airing on September 8, 2004, and the premiere episode was viewed by 2,69 mln viewers, (with 24,1% share in 16–49 group).{{Cite web|url=http://www.showmag.info/2004/10/13/dobry-start-nieustraszonych/|title=Dobry start "Nieustraszonych"|last=Showmag.info|date=2004-10-13|website=Showmag.info|access-date=2017-07-27}} The whole series have seen 2,5 mln viewers (in 16–49 group – 1,47 mln).{{Cite web|url=http://www.showmag.info/2004/12/10/ogladalnosc-nieustraszonych/|title=Oglądalność "Nieustraszonych"|last=Showmag.info|date=2004-12-10|website=Showmag.info|access-date=2017-07-27}} The day after the main episode (on Saturdays at 11:00 p.m.) Polsat was airing '''''Fear Factor – Nieustraszeni. Poza cenzurą''''' – which was showing scenes that could not be aired before 11:00 p.m. == Finalists{{Cite web|url=http://www.showmag.info/2004/11/12/znamy-juz-5-finalistow-polskiego-fear-factor/|title=Znamy już 5 finalistów polskiego "Fear Factor"|last=Showmag.info|date=2004-11-11|website=Showmag.info|access-date=2017-07-27}} == {| class="wikitable" !Miejsce !Imię i nazwisko !Wiek |- bgcolor="gold" |'''1.''' |'''Artur Lewandowski''' |'''29'''{{Cite web|url=http://www.showmag.info/2004/12/04/final-fear-factor-nieustraszonych/|title=Finał "Fear Factor – Nieustraszonych"|last=Showmag.info|date=2004-12-03|website=Showmag.info|access-date=2017-07-27}} |- bgcolor="silver" |2. |Marcin Jóźkiewicz |25 |- | rowspan="4" |? |Agata Steinhoff |24 |- |Wojciech Boretti-Wesołowski |23 |- |Anna Cichoń |20 |- |Lilianna Nogal{{Cite web|url=http://www.showmag.info/2004/11/16/rozmowa-z-szosta-finalistka-fear-factor/|title=Rozmowa z szóstą finalistką "Fear Factor"|last=Showmag.info|date=2004-11-15|website=Showmag.info|access-date=2017-07-27}} |19 |} [[File:Roman_Polko.jpg|center|thumb|[[Roman Polko]], Polish general and host of the program.]] == References == {{Reflist|100em}} {{improve categories|date=January 2018}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fear Factor - Nieustraszeni}} [[Category:Stunts]] [[Category:Polsat shows]] {{Poland-stub}} {{Reality-tv-prog-stub}}

{{distinguish|Gamercom|game.com}} {{Infobox convention | name = Gamescom | logo= Gamescom Logo.svg | image = Koelnmesse, Eingang Ost-0010.jpg | caption = The [[Koelnmesse]] (eastern entrance) where the event is annually held. | status = Active | genre = [[Video game]]s
[[Interactive entertainment]] | venue = [[Koelnmesse]] | location = [[Cologne]], [[North Rhine-Westphalia]] | coordinates = {{coord|50.94257|N|6.958976|E|type:landmark_source:frwiki}} | country = [[Germany]] | first = {{Start date and age|df=y|2009|8|19}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tradefairdates.com/gamescom-M696/Cologne.html|title=gamescom Cologne|publisher=Trade Fair Dates|accessdate=13 January 2016}} | last ={{end date|2018|8}} | next = {{Start date and age|df=y|2019|8|20}}{{cita web|language=German|title=gamescom 2019 in Köln|url=https://www.instaff.jobs/messen/2019/k%C3%B6ln/gamescom/10389|accessdate=24 August 2018}} | attendance = {{increase}} 370,000 {{small|(2018)}} | organizer = game – Verband der deutschen Games-Branche | website = {{URL|www.gamescom-cologne.com/}} | footnotes = }} '''Gamescom''' (stylized as '''gamescom''') is a [[trade fair]] for [[video game]]s held annually at the [[Koelnmesse]] in [[Cologne]], [[North Rhine-Westphalia]], [[Germany]]. Beginning in 2018, it is organised by ''game – Verband der deutschen Games-Branche''; and before that, by the Bundesverband Interaktive Unterhaltungssoftware (BIU) (English: Association of the german videogames industry).[https://www.game.de/en/events-and-partnerships/gamescom/ game - Gamescom information] Until 2008, it was held in [[Leipzig]], [[Saxony]], Germany. Gamescom is used by many [[video game developer]]s to exhibit upcoming games and game-related hardware.{{cite web|title=gamescom2018: first exhibitors confirmed |url=http://news.gamescom.de/en/2018/03/gamescom2018-first-exhibitors-confirmed/ }}{{cite web |url=http://www.gamezine.co.uk/news/formats/xbox360/lost-planet-2-make-ps3-debut-at-gamescom-$1318164.htm |title=Lost Planet 2 to make PS3 debut at GamesCom |date=2009-08-11 |publisher=Game Zine |accessdate=2009-08-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090815202201/http://www.gamezine.co.uk/news/formats/xbox360/lost-planet-2-make-ps3-debut-at-gamescom-$1318164.htm |archivedate=15 August 2009 |df=dmy }}{{cite web|url=http://videogamesrepublic.com/?p=7999|title=Sony confirms unveiling of new Heavy Rain character for Gamescom|date=2009-08-11|publisher=Video Games Republic|accessdate=2009-08-11}}{{cite web|url=http://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/namco-bandai-partners--gamescom-line-up-tekken-6--dragon-ball--raging-blast--dragon-ball--revenge-of-king-piccolo--one-piece-unlimited-cruise-2--tales-of-symphonia-trade---dawn-of-the-new-world--family-trainer--extreme-challenge--katamari-forever-and-cham|title=Namco Bandai Partners' gamescom line-up|last=Namco Bandai Partners (Press release)|date=2009-08-07|accessdate=2009-08-11}} Gamescom is the world's largest gaming event, (measured by exhibition space and number of visitors) with 370,000 visitors and 1037 exhibitors from 56 countries attending the show in 2018{{cite web|url=http://www.gamescom.global/news/content-for-media-representatives/press-information-of-gamescom/press-information-of-gamescom.php?aktion=pfach&p1id=kmpresse_gamescom_e&format=html&base=&tp=kme9&search=&pmid=kmeigen.kmpresse_0480_2018pm23_e&start=0&anzahl=10&channel=kmeigen&language=e&archiv=|title=Final Report Gamescom 2018|publisher=gamescom.global|accessdate=2018-05-21}} and the biggest gaming news expo of the year in [[Europe]]. ==Areas== *Business area *Cosplay village *Entertainment area *Family Computer Entertainment Europe]] '''Thursday, 19 August:''' * [[Microsoft Game Studios]] * [[Konami]] * [[Namco Bandai Games]] ==== Notable announcements ==== Sony Computer Entertainment Europe announced the [[PlayStation 3 Slim]], a smaller and lighter model of the console and a release date of 1 September 2009. Firmware 3.0 for the PlayStation 3 was also announced, adding new features to the [[PlayStation Network]]. Sony announced that the European Video Store would launch in November 2009. Sony also announced that the [[PlayStation Portable]] would get smaller games (under 100mb) in the form of 'minis' and that comics would also be available to download in December 2009. A "free game" registration promotion was announced for the [[PSP Go]]. Microsoft Game Studios announced ''[[Fable III]]'', along with a release date of 2010. Also, Microsoft announced their intention to release ''[[Fable II]]'' on the [[Xbox Live Marketplace]] in five episodes, the first of which will be free to download. ==== Media coverage ==== While most press conferences were not available for [[Streaming media|live streaming]], Electronic Arts was [[Streaming media|streaming]] its press conference on EA.com. Sony Computer Entertainment Europe also showcased its press conference on its online community-based service [[PlayStation Home]] shortly afterwards.{{cite web |url=https://blog.eu.playstation.com/2009/08/12/motorstorm-swerves-into-playstation-home-the-presentation-podium-opens-its-doors-for-gamescom/ |title=MotorStorm Swerves Into PlayStation Home; The Presentation Podium Opens Its Doors For gamescom |publisher=[[Sony Computer Entertainment]] |first=Elliott |last=Linger |date=12 August 2009 |access-date=24 August 2018 |work=[[Playstation Blog]]}} Sony also made its press conference available for download on the [[PlayStation Store]]. Various gaming websites offered live-blogging of the respective press conferences. ===2010=== [[File:Haus der Computerspiele 3.jpg|thumb|Retro exhibition at Gamescom 2010]] Gamescom 2010 was held from [[Insomniac Games]], who announced two sequels from two of their franchises: ''[[Ratchet & Clank: All 4 One]]'', by revealing some gameplay from the game, and ''[[Resistance 3]]'', via a [[live action]] teaser trailer. These games will be exclusive to the PlayStation 3. ''All 4 One'' has a set release date as late 2011, while ''Resistance 3'' did not have a release date. ===2011=== [[File:FIFA 12 at GamesCom 2011.jpg|thumb|right|[[FIFA 12]] demo booth at Gamescom From 2009 to 2016, the Game Developers Conference Europe (GDC Europe), a European spinoff of the [[Game Developers Conference]], has been held in conjunction with the Gamescom. The Conference took place at the Cologne Congress Centre East.{{cite web |url=http://www.gdceurope.com/aboutgdc/ |title=About Game Developers Conference Europe |date=15-16 August 2016 |location=Cologne, Germany |work=[[GDC Europe]] |publisher=[[UBM Tech]] |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130124040649/http://www.gdceurope.com/aboutgdc/ |archive-date=24 January 2013 |access-date=24 August 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all }} == See also == * [[Electronic Entertainment Expo]] * [[PAX (event)]] * [[Brasil Game Show]] * [[Gamercom]] * [[Game Developers Conference]] * [[Games Convention]] * [[Asia Game Show]] * [[Paris Games Week]] * [[Tokyo Game Show]] * [[IgroMir]] * [[Video gaming in Germany]] == References == {{Reflist|2|refs= {{Cite web |title=EA GamesCom 2009 Press Conference Video Archive |deadurl=yes |url=http://www.ea.com/blogs/gamescom/gamescom-press-conference |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100914220355/http://www.ea.com/blogs/gamescom/gamescom-press-conference |archivedate=14 September 2010}} }} ==External links== {{Commons category|Gamescom}} * {{Official website}} {{portal bar|Europe|Germany|Video games}} {{Video Game Trade Shows|state=expanded}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2011}} [[Category:August events]] [[Category:Events in Germany]] [[Category:Recurring events established in 2009]] [[Category:Tourist attractions in Cologne]] [[Category:Trade fairs in Germany]] [[Category:Video game events]] [[Category:Video game trade shows]] [[Category:Video gaming in Germany]]

{{Infobox person | name = Larry Gelbart | image = Larrygelbart.jpg | imagesize = 150px | other_names = Francis Burns, Elsig | birth_name = Larry Simon Gelbart | birth_date = {{Birth date|1928|02|25}} | birth_place = [[Chicago, Illinois]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|2009|09|11|1928|02|25}} | death_place = [[Beverly Hills, California]] | resting_place = [[Hillside Memorial Park Cemetery]], [[Culver City, California]] | occupation = Author, playwright | spouse = {{marriage|Patricia Marshall
|1956}} | children = 2 | years_active = 1944–2009 | signature = LarryGelbart.png }} '''Larry Simon''' '''Gelbart''' (February 25, 1928 – September 11, 2009){{cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/news/obituaries/la-me-larry-gelbart12-2009sep12,0,2812430.story|title='MASH' writer Larry Gelbart dies at 81|last=McLellan|first=Dennis|date=2009-09-11|publisher=[[Los Angeles Times]]|accessdate=2009-09-11}} was an American television writer, playwright, screenwriter, director and author, most famous as a creator and producer of the television series ''[[M*A*S*H (TV series)|M*A*S*H]]'', and as co-writer of Broadway musicals ''[[City of Angels (musical)|City of Angels]]'' and ''[[A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum]]''. ==Biography== ===Early life=== Gelbart was born in Chicago, Illinois, to [[Jewish]] immigrants Harry Gelbart, "a barber since his half of a childhood in [[Latvia]],"{{cite book | last=Gelbart | first=Larry | title=Laughing Matters: On Writing MASH, Tootsie, Oh, God!, and a Few Other Funny Things | location=New York | publisher=Random House | year=1998 | isbn=0-679-42945-X }} and Frieda Sturner, who migrated to America from [[Dąbrowa Górnicza]], [[Poland]]. Marcia Gelbart Walkenstein was his sister. His family later moved to Los Angeles and he attended [[Fairfax High School (Los Angeles)|Fairfax High School]]. Drafted shortly after World War Two, Gelbart worked for the [[Armed Forces Radio Service]] in Los Angeles.{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/news/obituaries/la-me-larry-gelbart12-2009sep12,0,2812430.story#axzz2u5iBIuLR |title=Larry Gelbart dies at 81; 'MASH' writer - Los Angeles Times |publisher=Latimes.com |date=1928-02-25 |accessdate=2014-07-04}} ===Television=== Gelbart began as a writer at the age of sixteen for [[Danny Thomas]]'s [[radio]] show after his father, who was Thomas's [[barber]], showed Thomas some jokes Gelbart had written. During the 1940s Gelbart also wrote for [[Jack Paar]] and [[Bob Hope]]. In the 1950s, his most important work in [[television]] involved writing for [[Red Buttons]], for [[Sid Caesar]] on ''[[Caesar's Hour]]'', and in [[Celeste Holm]]'s ''[[Honestly, Celeste!]]'', as well as with writers [[Mel Tolkin]], [[Michael Stewart (playwright)|Michael Stewart]], [[Selma Diamond]], [[Neil Simon]], [[Mel Brooks]], [[Carl Reiner]] and [[Woody Allen]] on two Caesar specials.Malarcher, Jay (2003). ''The Classically American Comedy of Larry Gelbart''. Lanham, Md.: The Scarecrow Press. {{ISBN|0-8108-4772-8}}. In 1972, Gelbart was one of the main forces behind the creation of the television series [[M*A*S*H (TV series)|''M*A*S*H'']], writing the pilot (for which he received a "Developed for Television by __" credit); then producing, often writing and occasionally directing the series for its first four seasons, from 1972 to 1976. ''M*A*S*H'' earned Gelbart a [[Peabody Award]] and an [[Emmy Award|Emmy]] for [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Comedy Series|Outstanding Comedy Series]] and went on to considerable commercial and critical success. ===Films=== Gelbart's best known screen work is perhaps the screenplay for 1982's ''[[Tootsie]]'', which he co-wrote with [[Murray Schisgal]]. He was nominated for an Academy Award for that script, and also was Oscar-nominated for his adapted screenplay for 1977's ''[[Oh, God! (film)|Oh, God!]]'' starring [[John Denver]] and [[George Burns]]. On his relationship with actor Dustin Hoffman in ''Tootsie'', Gelbart is reported to have said, "Never get involved in a film where the Oscar-winning star is smaller than the statuette." He later retracted this statement, saying that it was just a joke. He collaborated with Burt Shevelove on the screenplay for the 1966 British film ''[[The Wrong Box]]''. Gelbart also co-wrote the golden-era film spoof ''[[Movie Movie]]'' (1978) starring [[George C. Scott]] in dual roles, the racy comedy ''[[Blame It on Rio]]'' (1984) starring [[Michael Caine]] and the 2000 remake of ''[[Bedazzled (2000 film)|Bedazzled]]'' with [[Elizabeth Hurley]] and [[Brendan Fraser]]. His script for ''[[Rough Cut (1980 film)|Rough Cut]]'' (1980), a caper film starring [[Burt Reynolds]], [[Lesley-Anne Down]] and [[David Niven]], was credited under the pseudonym Francis Burns. Gelbart-scripted films for television included ''[[Barbarians at the Gate (film)|Barbarians at the Gate]]'' (1993), a true story about the battle for control of the [[RJR Nabisco]] corporation starring [[James Garner]] that was based on [[Barbarians at the Gate|the best-selling book of that name]]; the original comedy ''[[Weapons of Mass Distraction]]'' (1997) starring [[Ben Kingsley]] and [[Gabriel Byrne]] as rival media moguls; and ''[[And Starring Pancho Villa as Himself]]'' (2003) starring [[Antonio Banderas]] as the Mexican revolutionary leader. ===Broadway=== Gelbart co-wrote the long-running [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] [[farce|musical farce]] ''[[A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum]]'' with [[Burt Shevelove]] and [[Stephen Sondheim]] in 1962. After the show received poor reviews and box-office returns during its previews in Washington, D.C., rewrites and restaging helped; it was a smash Broadway hit and ran for 964 performances. Its book won a [[Tony Award]]. A film version starring [[Zero Mostel]] and directed by [[Richard Lester]], was released in 1966. Gelbart was critical of the movie, as most of his and Shevelove's [[libretto]] was largely rewritten. Gelbart's other Broadway credits include the musical ''[[City of Angels (musical)|City of Angels]]'', which won him the [[Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Book of a Musical]], the [[Tony Award for Best Book of a Musical]], and an [[Edgar Award]]. He also wrote the Iran-contra [[satire]] ''[[Mastergate (play)|Mastergate]]'', as well as ''[[Sly Fox]]'' and a musical adaptation of the [[Preston Sturges]] movie ''[[Hail the Conquering Hero]]'', whose grueling development inspired Gelbart to utter what evolved into the classic quip, "If [[Adolf Hitler|Hitler]] is alive, I hope he's out of town with a musical."See e.g. {{cite news | last = Barthel | first = Joan | title = Life for Simon—-Not That Simple | newspaper = The New York Times | page = D9 | date = February 25, 1968 }}, cited in {{cite web | url = http://www.barrypopik.com/index.php/new_york_city/entry/if_hitlers_still_alive_i_hope_hes_out_of_town_with_a_musical_larry_gelbart | title = If Hitler’s still alive, I hope he’s out of town with a musical (Larry Gelbart) | last = Popik | first = Barry | date = September 11, 2009 | website = The Big Apple | access-date = March 8, 2016 }}. According to Martin Gottfried, when producer Robert Whitehead tried to divert Gelbart by musing about how the ongoing war crimes trial of [[Adolf Eichmann]] might turn out, Gelbart shot back, "They ought to send him out of town with a musical." {{cite book | last = Gottfried | first = Martin | title = All His Jazz: The Life and Death of Bob Fosse | publisher = Da Capo | edition = 2nd | date = 2003 | location = New York | page = 128 | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=5Vr0l7Ux2OAC&pg=PA128#v=onepage&q=eichmann%20%22out%20of%20town%22%20musical | isbn = 978-0-306-81284-2 }} ===Memoirs=== In 1997, Gelbart published his memoir, ''Laughing Matters: On Writing M*A*S*H, Tootsie, Oh, God! and a Few Other Funny Things''. ===Blogger=== Gelbart was a contributing blogger at ''[[The Huffington Post]]'', and also was a regular participant on the alt.tv.mash [[Usenet]] newsgroup as "Elsig". ==Honors== In 1995, a Golden Palm Star on the [[Palm Springs, California]], [[Palm Springs Walk of Stars|Walk of Stars]] was dedicated to him.{{cite web|url=http://www.palmspringswalkofstars.com/web-storage/Stars/Stars%20dedicated%20by%20date.pdf |title=Palm Springs Walk of Stars : Listed by Date Dedicated |publisher=Palmspringswalkofstars.com |accessdate=2014-07-04 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121013165655/http://www.palmspringswalkofstars.com/web-storage/Stars/Stars%20dedicated%20by%20date.pdf |archivedate=2012-10-13 |df= }} He won an [[Emmy Award]] for [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Comedy Series|Outstanding Comedy Series]] in 1974 for ''M*A*S*H''. In 2002, Gelbart was inducted into the [[American Theatre Hall of Fame]].{{cite web |url=http://209.183.229.132/news/article/72902-32nd-Annual-Theatre-Hall-of-Fame-Inductees-Announced-Mamet-Channing-Grimes-Among-Names |title=32nd Annual Theatre Hall of Fame Inductees Announced; Mamet, Channing, Grimes Among Names – Playbill.com |publisher=209.183.229.132 |date= |accessdate=2014-07-04 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140223013813/http://209.183.229.132/news/article/72902-32nd-Annual-Theatre-Hall-of-Fame-Inductees-Announced-Mamet-Channing-Grimes-Among-Names |archivedate=2014-02-23 |df= }} In 2008, he was inducted into the [[Television Hall of Fame]].{{cite web|url=http://www.emmys.com/awards/hall-of-fame-honorees|title=Television Hall of Fame Honorees: Complete List|publisher=Emmys.com|accessdate=2014-07-04}} ===Death=== Gelbart was diagnosed with [[cancer]] in June and died at his Beverly Hills home on September 11, 2009. His wife of 53 years, Pat Gelbart, said that after being married for so long, "we finished each other's sentences." She declined to specify the type of cancer he had.{{cite news|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5ix5WW8PoZMC82BvqU_LEuyYkP97AD9ALDV4O0 | title='M-A-S-H' writer Larry Gelbart dies at 81 | agency=Associated Press | accessdate=2009-09-11}} He was buried at the [[Hillside Memorial Park Cemetery]] in [[Culver City, California]].{{Find a Grave|41841414}} ==Writing credits== * ''[[Duffy's Tavern]]'' (1941–1951) (Radio) * ''[[The Red Buttons Show]]'' (1952) (TV) * ''[[Honestly, Celeste!]]'' (1954) (TV) * ''[[Caesar's Hour]]'' (1954–1957) (TV) * ''[[The Patrice Munsel Show]]'' (1957) (TV) * ''[[The Dinah Shore Chevy Show]]'' (1958) (TV) * ''[[The Art Carney Special|The Art Carney Show]]'' (1959) (TV) * ''[[Startime]]'' (1959) (TV) * ''The Best of Anything'' (1960) (TV) * ''Hooray for Love'' (1960) (TV) * ''[[A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum]]'' (with [[Burt Shevelove]]) (1962) (Theater) * ''[[The Notorious Landlady]]'' (with [[Blake Edwards]]) (1962) * ''Judy and her guests, Phil Silvers and Robert Goulet'' (1963) (TV) * ''[[The Thrill of It All (film)|The Thrill of It All]]'' (1963) (story only) * ''[[The Danny Kaye Show]]'' (1963) (TV) * ''[[The Wrong Box]]'' (with [[Burt Shevelove]]) (1966) * ''[[Not with My Wife, You Don't!]]'' (with [[Norman Panama]] and [[Peter Barnes (playwright)|Peter Barnes]]) (1966) * ''[[A Fine Pair]]'' (1967) (uncredited) * ''Eddie'' (1971) (TV) * ''[[The Marty Feldman Comedy Machine]]'' (1971) (TV) * ''Roll Out'' (1972) (TV) * ''[[M*A*S*H (TV series)|M*A*S*H]]'' (1972–1983) (TV) (also Co-Creator, with [[Gene Reynolds]]) * ''If I Love You, Am I Trapped Forever?'' And A Few Other Funny Things'' (1999) (Autobiography) * ''C-Scam'' (2000) (TV) * ''[[Bedazzled (2000 film)|Bedazzled]]'' (with [[Harold Ramis]] and [[Peter Tolan]]) (2000) * ''[[And Starring Pancho Villa as Himself]]'' (2003) (TV) ==''M*A*S*H'' episodes== The following is a list of ''M*A*S*H'' episodes (42 Total) written and/or directed by Gelbart. ===Season one (9/17/72–3/25/73)=== * Episode 1: [[Pilot (M*A*S*H)|The Pilot]] (Written) * Episode 4: "Chief Surgeon Who?" {{EngvarB|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Le Pustra | image = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | alias = Mr Pustra | origin = | genre = [[Cabaret]], [[Performance Art]], [[Torch songs]] | occupation = [[Performance artist]], [[singer]], [[Model (person)|model]] | years_active = {{Start date|2006}}–Present | label = | associated_acts = [[Amanda Palmer]], [[The Tiger Lillies]], [[Klaus Nomi]], [[Jobriath]] | website = {{URL|www.lepustra.com}} | current_members = Performers: Le Pustra. | past_members = }} '''Le Pustra''' (1 July 1977) is a multidisciplinary theatre maker, singer, model and performance artist. He was originally part of the comedy Cabaret duo, [[Pustra/Vile-een's Vaudeville]].<ref> {{cite web | url=https://www.timeout.com/london/cabaret/londons-new-variety-scene | title=London's new variety scene | first=Simone | last=Baird | date=31 July 2007 | publisher=TimeOut | location=London | accessdate=12 June 2018 }}</ref> Le Pustra is known for his often macabre white face make-up, signature red lips and androgynous styling, sometimes resembling a [[Weimar]] porcelain doll. A self-proclaimed '''[[Bon Vivant]]''' and 'Vaudeville's Darkest Muse', He appears regularly on the International Circuit in [[Cabaret]], Burlesque,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://burlesquemap.blogspot.com/2012/12/chaz-royal-celebrating-his-10-year.html|title=BURLESQUE MAP LONDON: Chaz Royal: Celebrating his 10 Year Anniversary in Burlesque - Friday 23rd November 2012 at Bush Hall, London|first=Eva|last=Lamour|date=8 December 2012|publisher=}}</ref> [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] and has appeared in cities such as Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco, New York, Paris, Berlin, Vienna, Perth (Australia), Stockholm and Venice. He is much admired and respected for his personal style, unique persona and melancholic live performances.
==Early life==
Le Pustra was born in South Africa and adopted at birth. He was raised in a middle-class family in a small coastal town, and in 2000 he moved to London to pursue a career in [[Musical Theater]] but struggled to find work. He had a few day jobs ranging from an usher at [[Theatre Royal Drury Lane]] in Covent Garden to a kitchen porter in Surrey. There was also a brief stint as a [[Cher]] impersonator on a Cruise Ship, a [[Tarot]] reader in a nightclub and as an 'Extra' in British Soap Operas.
==Le Pustra's Kabarett Der Namenlosen== In 2016, Le Pustra created a contemporary reimagining of the Cabarets and Nightclubs from 1920's Berlin, entitled '''Le Pustra's Kabarett der Namenlosen'''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/travel/europe/berlin-alternative-clubs-nightlife-berghain-lgbt-kabarett-der-namenlosen-ballhaus-porn-karaoke-a7371336.html|title=Berlin's alternative nightlife, from cabaret to porno karaoke|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/babylon-berlin-burlesque-bauhaus-guide|title=From Burlesque to Bauhaus, Here’s Where to Find the Roaring ’20s in Berlin Today|publisher=}}</ref> ''or'' Cabaret of the Nameless featuring selected music from [[Friedrich Hollaender]], [[Mischa Spoliansky]] and [[Kurt Weill]]. The original show was a notorious but popular Cabaret in Weimar-era Berlin from 1926 till 1932 and created by Erich "Elow" Lowinsky. In October 2017, Le Pustra and the cast of Kabarett der Namenlosen performed "[[Das lila Lied]]" for the [[BBC Four]] series ''Tunes for Tyrants: Music and Power with Suzy Klein''.<ref name="bbc.co.uk">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b097f5vs|title=BBC Four - Tunes for Tyrants: Music and Power with Suzy Klein|website=BBC}}</ref> in 2016 and 2017 American Artist, [[Ella Guru]] created two large oil paintings inspired by the show. In 2018, Irish artist Alana Richards created a series of paintings and an art exhibition based on the show's characters entitled: '''Morphium: Hallucinations of a Kabarett'''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.morgenpost.de/incoming/article213599067/Fuenf-Szenetipps-Von-Schnapsfestival-bis-Graffiti-Schau.html |title=Sechs Wochenendtipps: Von Schnapsfestival bis Graffiti-Schau |language=de |publisher=Berliner Morgenpost |date=2 March 2018}}</ref>
==Television appearances== in 2018, Le Pustra appeared on [[Anthony Bourdain]]'s '''Parts Unknown'''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://explorepartsunknown.com/berlin/bourdain-off-the-cuff-berlin/|title=Here's what Tony and his guests had to say about Berlin|date=6 June 2018|publisher=}}</ref> Season 11 (Episode 6) which aired on [[CNN]] and in October 2017, Le Pustra and the cast of Kabarett der Namenlosen performed "[[Das lila Lied]]" for the [[BBC Four]] series ''Tunes for Tyrants: Music and Power with [[Suzy Klein]]''.<ref name="bbc.co.uk"/>
==Music Videos== Le Pustra performed as two characters in the music video for '''Black for the Occasion'''<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VbHExjggPEc</ref> by Faroese artist, [[Heiðrik á Heygum]].
==Noted appearances== In early 2011, Le Pustra co-produced and wrote a Vaudevillian all-male show entitled 'Villains'<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.romadailynews.it/2011/01/teatro-palladium-levento-teatrale-dellanno-villains/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-10-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120724151729/http://www.romadailynews.it/2011/01/teatro-palladium-levento-teatrale-dellanno-villains |archivedate=24 July 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> which was produced in Rome's Teatro Palladium. The show had a short run but made a huge impact on Le Pustra's career and established him firmly on the scene. Le Pustra connected with the Italian audience and they in turn, adored his vulnerability and uniqueness. Le Pustra attributes much of his development to his time working in Italy. The show returned to Rome for one night only on 5 September 2011 at the Villa Celimontana Festival.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://roma.corriere.it/roma/notizie/tempo_libero/11_agosto_28/villa-celimontana-chiusura-1901379121358.shtml|title=Villa Celimontana chiude la stagione con i Villains di Mr Pustra e Joe Black - Corriere Roma|website=roma.corriere.it}}</ref>
In 2012, Le Pustra collaborated with [[Amanda Palmer]], [[Neil Gaiman]], Victor Victoria from musical duo, [[EastEnd Cabaret]], Adrian Stout from cult Cabaret group, [[The Tiger Lillies]] and also [[The Irrepressibles]] as a guest musical saw player. He also collaborates with contemporary performers on various projects and is the subject and inspiration for numerous art works, especially paintings.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.saatchiart.com/art/Painting-Le-Pustra/88795/1717489/view |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-10-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141022082732/http://www.saatchiart.com/art/Painting-Le-Pustra/88795/1717489/view |archivedate=22 October 2014 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
Other appearances include [[The Royal Academy of Arts]], [[Skibo Castle]], [[Wilton's Music Hall]], The Box, The Last Tuesday Society, Torture Garden, The Secret Garden Party, Tipi am Kanzleramt, Wintergarten Varieté Berlin, Home House Private Member's Club, Madame JoJo's and club night ''''The Face'''' alongside 'king of the Noe-Romantics and former 'The Blitz' <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theblitzkids.com/promo/face0311.html|title=theblitzkids.com is coming soon|website=www.theblitzkids.com}}</ref> club owner, [[Steve Strange]]. It is here where Le Pustra was introduced to [[Adam Ant]], who came to watch Le Pustra's show. International credits include Palais de Toyko (Paris), [[Coney Island]] <ref>http://www.coneyislandfunguide.com/Events/Noisefest-at-Coney-Island-USA--FREE_4_3_2011-2730.htm</ref> in New York, Perth World Fringe Festival,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.outinperth.com/sideshow-macabre/|title=Sideshow Macabré - OUTInPerth - LGBTIQ News and Culture - OUTInPerth – LGBTIQ News and Culture|website=www.outinperth.com}}</ref> Södra Teatern (Stockholm), Schirn Kunsthalle Frankfurt.<ref>http://www.schirn-magazin.de/SCHIRN_AT_NIGHT_in_der_Ausstellung_Geheimgesellschaften.html</ref> and the world-famous [[Venice Carnival]]. In 2014, Le Pustra appeared in Director Shelly Love's fantasy film 'The Fallen Circus'<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.shellylove.co.uk/portfolio/the-fallen-circus-chapter-one|title=The Fallen Circus – Chapter One|publisher=}}</ref> playing a latex-clad villain and can also be heard on the film's score as a guest musical saw player. Le Pustra's costume was designed by Oliver Garcia who have worked on films such as [[Maleficent_(film)]] and [[Hugo_(film)]].
==Fashion and publications== In 2010, Le Pustra produced and directed a fashion video for Serbian designer [http://markomitanovski.com/ Marko Mitanovski] which were screened at [[London Fashion Week]], London's [[Selfridges]] and Malaysian International Fashion Week. The short fashion film, [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-utyqd8D8Uc 'Mr Pustra’s Lament Act II'] was selected to screen at celebrated fashion curator/blogger, [[Diane Pernet]]‘s Film Festival, '''[http://ashadedviewonfashion.com/ A Shaded View on Fashion Film]''' in Milan, Italy on June 2012. That same year Le Pustra walked in [[London_Fashion_Week]] for designer Ziad Ghanem <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.retoxmagazine.com/ziad-ghanem-ss12-matka-johanna.html|title=Exceptional models bring Matka Joanna to lifes|publisher=}}</ref> and was invited back the following year. Le Pustra also modeled for up-and-coming fashion designer [http://ivanapilja.com/ Ivana Pilja] in 2013 and they collaborated once again for Berlin Alternative Fashion Week [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2wsIEwZOUZs] in September 2015 and March 2016. Other credits include a fashion campaign for [[Air_Berlin]], a cameo in the fashion film: '[https://vimeo.com/28612774 The Dionysian'] directed by Stephen Lally, appearances in British and Italian Vogue,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vogue.it/en/photovogue/Portfolio/c3f286db-5b5a-4f5a-8938-ade1a22f6d4e/Image|title=PhotoVogue - Vogue|website=www.vogue.it}}</ref> Hunger Magazine,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hungertv.com/feature/katy-kingston/|title=Katy Kingston|publisher=}}</ref> [[Reuters]], <ref>{{cite web|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-germany-berlin-nightlife-idUKKCN11P15B|title=In Berlin, the party goes on despite threat of club closures|first=Hannibal|last=Hanschke|publisher=}}</ref> French Playboy, [[I-D]], Dark Beauty Magazine,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.darkbeautymag.com/2014/08/behind-the-scenes-with-le-pustra/|title=Behind the Scenes with Le Pustra|publisher=}}</ref> Spindle Magazine<ref>{{cite web|url=http://spindlemagazine.com/2010/12/spindle-photoshoot-with-mr-pustra/|title=Spindle Magazine|first=WMA|last=Studios|website=spindlemagazine.com}}</ref> and various published books on nightlife and clubbing culture: New Club Kids: London Party Fashion in the Noughties<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.waterstones.com/waterstonesweb/products/oggy+yordanov/new+club+kids/8136981/|title=New Club Kids by Oggy Yordanov - Waterstones|website=www.waterstones.com}}</ref> by photographer, Oggy Yordanov, 'What Else Is In The Teaches of Peaches <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/What-Else-Teaches-Peaches/dp/1617753572/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1439065701&sr=1-1&keywords=peaches|title=What Else Is in the Teaches of Peaches|first1=|last1=Peaches|first2=Holger|last2=Talinski|first3=Yoko|last3=Ono|first4=Ellen|last4=Page|first5=Michael|last5=Stipe|date=16 July 2015|publisher=Akashic Books|via=Amazon}}</ref> by [[Peaches_(musician)]] 'Night Flowers' by Damien Frost <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.merrellpublishers.com/?9781858946481|title=merrellpublishers.com|first=|last=http://www.herechickychicky.com|website=www.merrellpublishers.com}}</ref> and 'Boy Story'<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boystory.org/|title=Magnus Arrevad Photography - It doesn't have to be boring|website=Magnus Arrevad}}</ref> by Magnus Arrevad. His image have been captured at [[National Portrait Gallery, London|The National Portrait Gallery]] in London and the historical Musical Hall, [[Hackney Empire]]. Social Media has played a significant role in shaping and promotion of Le Pustra's artistic career and his work and visual style is subject of numerous online magazines and [[Blogs]] <ref>{{cite web |url=http://manbehindthecurtain.ie/2012/11/11/style-icons-mr-pustra/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-10-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141018182704/http://manbehindthecurtain.ie/2012/11/11/style-icons-mr-pustra/ |archivedate=18 October 2014 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.lepustra.com Official Website] * [http://www.facebook.com/LePustra Facebook] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kCc3vLN2C7U Le Pustra at London Fashion Week] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vtEvryLLYQk Le Pustra talks to Suzy Klein]

page.title: List of Philippine television ratings for 2008

revision.text:
{{One source|date=May 2009}} [[File:2008 Philippine daytime ratings.png|250px|thumb|Daytime ratings for 2008: GMA is blue and ABS-CBN is red; the three highest GMA spikes indicate GMA's broadcast of [[Manny Pacquiao]]'s bouts, the smallest spike indicates GMA's coverage of [[Rudy Fernandez (actor)|Rudy Fernandez]]'s burial.]] [[File:2008 Philippine primetime ratings.PNG|250px|thumb|Primetime ratings for 2008: GMA is blue and ABS-CBN is red; the highest spike refers to the ''[[Marimar (2007 TV series)|Marimar]]'' finale. The spike for GMA's primetime chart on April was the premiere of ''[[Dyesebel (TV series)|Dyesebel]]''. ABS-CBN's two largest spikes come from the finales of ''[[Pinoy Big Brother: Teen Edition Plus]]'' and ''[[Pinoy Dream Academy (season 2)|Pinoy Dream Academy]]''. ]] The following is a list of '''[[Philippines|Philippine]] [[television]] [[television ratings (audience measurement)|ratings]] for 2008''' coming from [[AGB Nielsen Philippines]]. Mega Manila accounts for about 48% of total TV households in urban Philippines. The Mega Manila and Luzon markets combined account for about 76% of the total TV households in urban Philippines. Non-urban households aren't included in both Mega Manila and NUTAM surveys. The largest television market is at [[Mega Manila]]; in AGB-Nielsen's case, Mega Manila consists of [[Metro Manila]], [[Bulacan]], [[Rizal]], [[Cavite]] and [[Laguna (province)|Laguna]]. Metro Manila and other urban areas in the Philippines comprise the National Urban Television Audience Measurement (NUTAM) and are scattered throughout the country. ==Markets== [[File:Mega Manila location.PNG|thumb|150px|right|Location of Mega Manila within the Philippines: Maroon for AGB Nielsen.]] {{further|AGB Nielsen Philippines}} Note that the National Urban Television Audience Measurement (NUTAM) does not represent the entire Philippines but only urban areas; NUTAM markets comprise 39% of the entire country. The Mega Manila market comprises 52% of the NUTAM market. ==National Urban Television Audience Measurement== In national urbal Philippines, the three [[Manny Pacquiao]] boxing bouts scored the highest ratings, each surpassing 45%, making GMA airing the top three aired programs in urban Philippines. The finales of ''[[Pinoy Big Brother: Teen Edition Plus]]'' and ''[[Pinoy Dream Academy (season 2)|Pinoy Dream Academy]]'' were next, and the finale of [[MariMar (Philippine TV series)|MariMar]] rounded up the top 5. ===Most watched programs=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !! Network !! Broadcast !! Period !! Rating !! Reference |- |1 || [[GMA Network|GMA]] || ''Unfinished Business: Marquez-Pacquiao II*'' || March || 48.6% || [http://www.pep.ph/news/17041/TV-Ratings:-Marimar,-Wowowee,-and-I-Am-KC-dominate-March-NUTAM-results PEP.ph] |- |2= || [[GMA Network|GMA]] || ''[[De La Hoya-Pacquiao boxing match|The Dream Match: De La Hoya vs. Pacquiao]]*'' || December || 46.0% || [http://www.pep.ph/news/18332/TV-Ratings:-Dyesebel-regains-NUTAM-primetime-leadership-for-June PEP.ph] |- |2= || [[ABS-CBN]] || ''[[Lobo (TV series)|Lobo]]'' || 1/27–2/2 || 36.3% || [http://www.pep.ph/news/16341/TV-Ratings:-Kung-Fu-Kids-rules-in-NUTAM;-Marimar-runaway-winner-in-Mega,-Metro,-and-Subs PEP.ph] |- |4 || [[ABS-CBN]] || ''[[Pinoy Big Brother: Teen Edition Plus|Pinoy Big Brother: Teen Edition Plus: The Big Night]]'' || June || 42.4% || [http://www.pep.ph/news/16341/TV-Ratings:-Kung-Fu-Kids-rules-in-NUTAM;-Marimar-runaway-winner-in-Mega,-Metro,-and-Subs PEP.ph] |- |5 || [[ABS-CBN]] || ''[[Pinoy Dream Academy (season 2)|Pinoy Dream Academy: Grand Dream Nights]]'' || September || 40.4% || [http://www.pep.ph/news/16341/TV-Ratings:-Kung-Fu-Kids-rules-in-NUTAM;-Marimar-runaway-winner-in-Mega,-Metro,-and-Subs PEP.ph] |- |6 || [[GMA Network|GMA]] || ''[[Marimar (2007 TV series)|Marimar]]'' || March || 38.1% || [http://www.pep.ph/news/17041/TV-Ratings:-Marimar,-Wowowee,-and-I-Am-KC-dominate-March-NUTAM-results PEP.ph] |- |7 || [[ABS-CBN]] || ''[[Pinoy Dream Academy: Little Dreamers|Pinoy Dream Academy: Little Dream Night]]'' || October || 37.5% || [http://www.pep.ph/news/19967/NUTAM-Ratings-(October):-Dyesebel-closes-campaign-on-top,-Wowowee-still-rules PEP.ph] |- |8 || [[ABS-CBN]] || ''[[Kung Fu Kids]]'' || 1/27–2/2 || 37.1% || [http://www.pep.ph/news/16341/TV-Ratings:-Kung-Fu-Kids-rules-in-NUTAM;-Marimar-runaway-winner-in-Mega,-Metro,-and-Subs PEP.ph] |- |9 || [[GMA Network|GMA]] || ''[[Marimar (2007 TV series)|Marimar]]'' || February || 36.9% || [http://www.pep.ph/news/16683/TV-Ratings:-Wowowee-and-Marimar-led-NUTAM-ratings-last-February PEP.ph] |- |} ==Mega Manila== ===Weekly ratings=== Week 1 began on December 30, 2007 and ended on January 5, 2008. The list will be updated every Sunday, when the week ends. AGB Nielsen defines "non-primetime" as prior to 6:30 pm and "primetime" as after 6:30 pm up to sign-off. GMA almost swept the weekly non-primetime and primetime races, if not for ABS-CBN's broadcast of the Hatton-Malinggagi bout that beat the GMA programs for the week of November 23–29. ABS-CBN fared better in weekend programming, but generally, ratings during the weekend are lower than their weekday counterparts. ABS-CBN won the primetime race during these days, all of them occurred during the weekend: *June 7: Airing of ''[[Pinoy Big Brother: Teen Edition Plus]]: The Big Night''TV ratings for the dates [http://www.pep.ph/guide/2078/TV-Ratings-(June-6-10):-Victory-and-death-highlight-weekend-ratings Jun 6-10], ''Philippine Entertainment Portal *June 8: Airing of ''[[Pinoy Big Brother: Teen Edition Plus]]: The Big Reunion'' *August 3: Airing of ''[[Pinoy Dream Academy: Little Dreamers]]''TV ratings for the dates [http://www.pep.ph/guide/2340/TV-Ratings-(August-1-3):-Eat-Bulaga!-and-SOP-rule-weekend-daytime-race Aug 1-3], ''Philippine Entertainment Portal *August 24: Airing of ''[[Pinoy Dream Academy: Little Dreamers]]''TV ratings for the dates [http://www.pep.ph/guide/2466/TV-Ratings-(Aug.-20-24)-ASAP-08-and-PDA-rule-Sunday-viewership Aug 20-24], ''Philippine Entertainment Portal *September 13 and 14: Airing of ''[[Pinoy Dream Academy (season 2)|Pinoy Dream Academy]]''TV ratings for the dates [http://www.pep.ph/guide/2578/TV-Ratings-(Sept.-12-15):-Pinoy-Dream-Academy-finale-reigns-supreme,-Survivor-Philippines-outplayed-Kahit-Isang-Saglit Sept 12-15], ''Philippine Entertainment Portal *September 28: Airing of ''[[Pinoy Dream Academy: Little Dreamers]]''TV ratings for the dates [http://www.pep.ph/guide/2665/TV-Ratings-(Sept.-26-29):-SOP-rules-over-ASAP-%2708 Sept 26-29], ''Philippine Entertainment Portal *October 5: Airing of ''[[Pinoy Dream Academy: Little Dreamers]]''TV ratings for the dates [http://www.pep.ph/guide/2699/TV-Ratings-(Oct.-3-5):-Showbiz-Central-tops-Sunday-daytime-viewing Oct 3-5], ''Philippine Entertainment Portal *October 11: Airing of ''[[Maalaala Mo Kaya]]''TV ratings 10 October 2012 |genre = [[Sports game|Sports]] ([[Olympic video games|Olympic]]) |modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]], [[Multiplayer video game|Multiplayer]] |platforms = {{unbulleted list|[[Cloud computing|Cloud]] ([[OnLive]])|[[Microsoft Windows]]|[[PlayStation 3]]|[[Xbox 360]]|[[Android (operating system)|Android]]|[[iOS]]}} }} '''''London 2012: The Official Video Game''''' is the official [[Olympic video games|Olympic video game]] of the [[2012 Summer Olympics]] in [[London]]. It was published by [[Sega]] and developed by [[Sega Studios Australia]], making this the first Olympics title to be developed in-house by Sega. The [[iOS]] and [[Android (operating system)|Android]] versions were developed and published by [[NEOWIZ]]. It is also the second official video game based on the 2012 Olympics, the other being ''[[Mario & Sonic at the London 2012 Olympic Games]]''. The game features an online mode for players wishing to compete with other challengers worldwide. The "national pride" is a ranking system in the online mode, where the players have the possibility to collect medals for their favorite country.{{cite web |last=Nichols |first=Scott |date=31 May 2011 |url=http://www.digitalspy.com/gaming/news/a322438/sega-announces-london-2012-olympics-game/ |title=Sega announces London 2012 Olympics game |website=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=[[Hearst Communications]] |accessdate=30 August 2018}} It is compatible with [[PlayStation Move]] and Xbox [[Kinect]] for certain events in the party mode.{{citation needed|date=August 2018}} ''London 2012'' is the first olympic video game that includes cooperative events in the local multiplayer mode. ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | align = left | iOS = true | PC = true | PS3 = true | X360 = true |
